messages.content: 15.5: Hate.

They awake in a space teeming with creative potential. Perhaps it could have contained a geometrically shaped room, or a labyrinth. It may have served as a place to wait. A place to die. A place where you can’t die. A gateway.

Let’s go with the last one, sure. Two doors are situated on opposite sides of a large circular platform that you have woken up in the center of. They have subtly different styles of construction compared to one another.

The platform is suspended in a pitch black abyss. But it’s actually quite lit up. Something like stars litter the space, softly illuminating everything and providing a vague feeling of warmth. Blue threads weave through the air, circling around the centralized platform. They seem somewhere in between physical and intangible; a compromise between a ribbon and the Aurora.

More than anything else, this is a location that provides you with a sense of calm. It is never exactly pleasant to find yourself unexpectedly awakening in an unfamiliar location, but you’ve had plenty of experience with that, for better or worse. And if it has to happen… this right now is one of the better places.

It’s nice.
And then this asshole shows up.
"Hello." I say this approaching Horatius, who would not recognize me.

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content:
I bow, and speak again without waiting for a response. "You may call me Ariadne. You'd lack the cultural context, but it means a guide who leads the way out of a labyrinth. It's a pleasure to finally meet you."

I smile. "Are you enjoying the show?"

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: I patiently await a response this time.

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: I look at the person in front of me. "...Why do you ask?"

"I would surmise you are less than content with certain things." I chuckle to myself. "But still, it was interesting, I think. Everything went about how I expected, but there were exceptions. Totally didn't see any of that stuff with Intuition coming, haha. It fits, though. A lot of people prescribing you some role or ideal they've invented."

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: "...Yes." I say hollowly. "Yes, I am used to that. Prescriptivism, generally." I continue to look at the person in front of me. Something familiar itches at my brain. "Have we met?"

"Mm, not technically. I'm really not sure how to pace out these sort of reveals, but I'll let slip that I was the unknown party who contacted you when you first got wrapped up in all of this. Maybe that was already too much...? Though on the other hand, I've already waited long enough that this information has lost all meaning or significance. Just another meaningless drop in the sea of #plot. That's why I just decided to go by a different name than, uh..." 
I stare into space. 
"Cogito! That was what I used as an alias. But it's Ariadne, really. Only brought this up because you asked. Honestly, the whole labyrinth gimmick was going to be much more elaborate originally. This whole massive trick, involving... Not that what I'm saying makes any sense to you. Or anyone but me." I place a palm on my forehead, exasperated. "Plans change. I got bored of that. I get bored of a lot of things. Anyway, most important part, I made you contact Avdol that one time, which led him to believe you were his dead daughter reincarnated or whatever. Whoops!" I say all of this efficiently and quickly. Who cares, really.

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: "And what purpose does that serve." H̶o̶r̶   - I, me, alone, say. I say this. "How could you possibly benefit from that?"
"Are you implying I was acting with deliberate intent?" I smirk. "How could I have known what any of that would result in? Are you so paranoid you can't believe someone wanted to help you?"

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: "You don't know me." I say. "Beyond whatever voyeurism you've been doing, I mean. Forgive me for not believing you're helping me for no reason..." Instead of ending that statement sharply, as I intended to, I trail off into incoherent babbling near the end. Fuck.

"Yes, yes, *nobody* knows you. That was the whole point, I get it, very clever. You are special, and mysterious, and complex and cool. Good job. You don't even know what... whatever." 
I cross my arms. "Glad you recognize I'm kind of a big deal, even if I'd object to the term voyeur. God, it really pissed me off, around the time you fucked off from everything -- when you like, referred to how *obvious* it was this person you were passing by was the mastermind... and that person was *Dawn*. Fucking *DA*? That's your best guess?" I laugh at a joke no one else can understand. "A million options would've been more correct. And you pick the person who masterminded the authoring of 'Gas Trick'."

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: The blue threads suspended in the void burst into flames as this impudent child stews in manic glee/rage.

"You reject me, and call theeeeemmmm the ruler of the witch's island? Kyehahahahahahaha!" It's obviously not how I actually laugh, but whatever. Reference secured.
"But no, no, it's *fine*. Nothing to be embarrassed about because you weren't really trying there. You don't fucking *care*. You recognize this whole conspiracy as a farce, the big epic TAP mystery as a bunch of meaningless dead ends, and you know what? You're right. Good job. I mean it." I clap briefly. "So let's focus on what you clearly care *so* much about, then --

Who the fuck are you, hm?"

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: H̶o̶ I stumble backwards, shocked by the sudden fire. My heart is beating strangely in my chest, all of a sudden, and I'm aware of my*self* all at once - my hand placed over my chest, steadying myself, the weight of my tongue in my mouth, the threading of my pulse through my body. I remind myself that this is another trick. A question that doesn't matter. I don't need to start having vague fear sweats because of this.
"I don't particularly care about answering that question. Can't we focus on something else? Like where I am?"
The second part of that sentence was meant to - once again - be a little bit more pointed. Instead, it comes out embarrassingly plaintive. Great.

"Oh, who cares. The guy who exposits about plot shit isn't here right now. We're nowhere. We're everywhere. This is what's in between. It's the they/them of places. You're dreaming, or whatever."
I wave my hand dismissively as the fire dies out.
"C'mooooon, work with me here. You're arcing out, great job! Leaving it behind. I thought maybe something could shake things up, so I waited, but I'm done. We just got done hours of like, getting a haircut. I give *up*, alright? Horatius Kyodu is dead. I'm not Avdol, or Zita, or John Fucking Leiblich or whoever. I'm not going to spend my existence obsessing over corpses, because I'm better than that." I laugh at this, for some reason.
"You win. Congratulations."

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: I flinch at the mention of the name. Which is objectively pretty stupid, isn't it? It's not like I've had the same reaction to any of the other easily-discarded pseudonyms. It's unreasonable for me to *care.*
"I don't feel much like I've won anything."

"Oh, really? Huh, that's strange. I guess you're broken."
Really isn't much of a labyrinth like this, is it?

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: There's walls and a ceiling now. Somehow.
"I alone won't let you run. Answer the question, Lyra. What's your *deal*? I'm really invested in this, y'know!"

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: I choke on my own spit. I make a noise like I've been shot. I engage in all sorts of terrible indicators of physical distress. Horatius - I - they - he - she walks backwards, puppeting the meat of *the body* with it.
Lyra looks at her hands. "I'm not -"
No. No, I don't want to do that. I don't.
I finish the sentence extremely neatly and calmly and in control of the situation. "I don't have a deal. Are you trying to provoke me on purpose?"

"Me? Never. It's just eeaaasy to do that on accident. Walking on eggshells. Tip from someone who's spent a fair bit of time pretending to be a man: whatever mirage of STRONG masculinity you're chasing wouldn't start dry heaving over a fucking name. Four letters, and not even one of the combinations that are a slur. Hmph." I smirk. Again. I kind of do that a lot.

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: And yet, there's some hint of discomfort, even regret, behind that expression.
What? No there isn't. Fuck you.

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: I turn my head to the side. "I'm no - nooot a man, either." The last syllable comes out mocking and pantomimed. Good. Control. "I'm not chasing any ideal of masculinity you've deluded yourself into thinking is personally meaningful to me. You don't know me at all."

"Ah, man, really? That's a relief. I just sort of thought, y'know, the aesthetics, visual makeover, rejection of your entire life so far... sort of compounds onto already existing stuff, like the mortifying fear of specifically being gendered as female, or trying to score like, ehaha, fuckin, an emotional support pillar femboy bf, or whatever. Haha." Horatius probably knows most of those words. Or, 'unknown' does, lmao. "...Made me think you were kind of done with the big joke of ambiguity. Just some amateur character analysis here. Never actually went to school for any of this."

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: I frown. "..Joke? Where's the joke.. I'm not... I'm..."

Horatius makes another noise. Or the thing formerly known as Horatius does. It's hard to say. The lines smear. Horatius's nose is running. My nose is running. Horatius's hands are cold. My hands are cold.

"It's a colloquial definition of the term. Not meant to imply I'm not taking you seriously."
I shrug.
"Hey, did you know Ariadne isn't actually my real name? I'm sure you're shocked by that one. You can call me it, though. It doesn't particularly matter."

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: "Is this supposed to be something said at my expense? Another little jab?"

"Not really. It isn't your fault that I know your deadname and you don't know mine. No one does. It's a mystery that can't be solved. That was something they made sure of. I may be an asshole, but I'm not unreasonable." 
I pause. 
"Well, I may be unreasonable, but... ah, whatever." 
I swat my hand in front of my face dismissively. "The point is that I get it. This isn't some subtle unconscious projection, or whatever. Again, amateur character analysis. You're a lot like me. I get that. Which is why I was confused for so long. Why you made me so... displeased. Not in a self-loathing sort of way."
I clear my throat. "See, I'm *passive*. Even beyond my big secret backstory or whatever, I lived my life as I had to until forced to change, at which point I did, so on and so forth. You were like that, too! At first. Though even comparing us early on... you were creating. You made up a guy and became that guy. Inspirational."
...
"I had to steal."

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content:
@We disappears. A man who is recognizably and unmistakably Bernard Zie, in a flash, is in the location the... that person was just in.
"But it's inauthentic, right? You can't expect someone else's clothes to fit."

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: "No, no, no, that's not... you piece of shit, I'll... don't *use* him for that. Don't take his image and turn it into *this.*"

"Oh, would you prefer Jane's body? That's the one you made out with. Easy to forget technical details like that when you're just running through the people involved and events that transpired in your mind." Bern takes on a derisive expression you've certainly never seen from him.

"I don't care," Lyra hisses, tremendously furious. "I left him *behind.* He was supposed to.. I was supposed to go off to Earth and it wouldn't *matter* anymore, this feculent heap of shit, from *aaaaallll* of you... I was supposed to remember him as something beautiful. I don't want Voreverl's body, and I certainly don't want m-my *boyfriend's* body from *you*. He's spent so much time as a meat puppet already, you... bastard..d."
SHit. I say this. Me. Leave that fucking thing out of this.

"Oh, come on. It's not like you actually *knew* him. This body's good enough, right? We can play pretend, a little you scratch my back I scratch yours sort of situation. You'll have a boyfriend who you can imagine is the real thing, one who won't leave you for his own ambitions, and I'll have someone who does the ooooone fucking thing I wanted from them, to just kill ONE guy." Bern laughs. "Joking! Joking. Wouldn't even make sense." He walks closer to you.

I back up. "I did know him. I knew - from the very beginning. I had to have known him. I had to have seen the real, the real fucking thing, beneath all the layers of pretense and obfuscation, what he really was. You're not him. He wouldn't do this to me."

I remember Bern leaving me alone to talk to fucking Avdol, of all people. I remember why I decided to leave in the first place, why pressing the reset button was so tremendously important to begin with. I can't let her see that. That unenviable weakness - these failings I saw on his part, if only for a moment. I just need - to get the upper hand, somehow... to.. get out. To run away.

"True. He probably wouldn't. I wonder if I could gaslight you into thinking he was never real? Like, oh man, I was Bern the whooole time! What a dogshit twist that would be. But nah, rest assured he's real. I'm not actually him. You probably won't have to see him ever again." Bern vanishes into mist.

I'm back.
"I did eventually get to the same point you did, where I just made up people to be. It took a bit, but it was something I'd started doing long before I interacted with you. For whatever time frame you want to go by. It's nice, having creative control. You can do anything you want."

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: "Is that it? Questioning me about authorship and ownership? I don't care about whatever monologue you're about to segue into. It's not my fault you've been projecting on to me this whooooooooole time."

"We know! You don't care. You neeeever care. It's important everyone knows that. I'm sorry this world isn't good enough for you, Lyra. That you're the only living thinking human in a paper-thin world. Arctica's fake, and Earth isn't even a coherent setting. Sorry for the spoilers, but there's no life there you'd be satisfied with. You want to know how to escape the labyrinth? You already figured out the answer. I'd have figured out some way to stop Catarina from intervening if I knew you'd be this much of a mess now." 
I grab from out of nowhere, since my control over this space is bullshit and arbitrary, the dumbest hat possible, known as a 'beanie'. I stare at it in my hands. In conjunction with me fucking with my appearance a little, this prompts a chain of connections in your mind.
"But if you can't do that, because of cowardice, or some other reason, your only real option is to pretend to give a shit."
You suddenly realize that if this person shaved all the hair on this person's head, and wore a hat and dressed a little differently while doing stuff to present masc, he'd look exactly like Eric Zeety. In fact, it's so amazingly obvious you wonder how you missed it before now. Are you stupid?

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: I don't care about that. I don't care about you or Arctica or fucking Eric Zeety, I don't care about any of it - but I don't say any of that out loud. I just think it in my mind, the white-hot heat of the mantra. That grounding force. "And if I did care?? What would that mean?? Why would you *want* that from me? I know you're expecting some performance of shock and awe at the revelation that you're Eric Zeety or whatever but I can't give you that. I can't give you *anything*."

The fabric of me remains pinned into place. I'm far from disciplined, now - I pull up my hands to cradle the soft crater of my face, my palms brushing the short cut of hair, and use it to pull myself apart, the smell of detergent and shampoo and new clothes, the smell of human things. I take myself in hand, lanced thinly through tremendous nonviable space, and explode.

Joke. I don't do this. I continue to cradle the back of my head like I'm holding a lover, the world's least tender and untouched hands. I stare hatefully at Ariadne/Eric/Who cares some more. I finish my sentence.

"Yes, that's us. Just two guys who simply don't care. Real sigma hangout, here. I don't expect you to care about this specifically, lmao." I say lmao out loud like a lunatic. "I don't expect anyone to care about Eric Fucking Zeety. He wasn't designed for that. My original character. I just needed to keep an eye on Voreverl. He's not the only one who exists by necessity." 
My appearance flickers between personas, various entities known to people relevant to this tale who were only ever fragments of myself. Sure, you can know I did that. I'm done trying to hide the ways I've hidden. I am one yet many. Just in a shitty boring way. I won't bother elaborating on who, because no one should care, much less Horatius. 
"The point is that I understand. I've had someone vaguely tolerate the presence of the fraud I had made of myself, and I know the conflict that can create. I'd give my advice, but you'd find some way to do the opposite of what I want. So again: who cares?"
I return to X.
"Man, isn't this conversation great?"

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: "...So what's the answer? That's what you want me to ask, right? You want me to ask what the answer is?"

I stare blankly for a moment, surprised.
"No, I was pretty confident you'd never ask that. Huh. Regardless, there really isn't one. You just suck it up."
I sigh. "I wanted to torture porn the hell out of you the way I did Viotto, but honestly, what's the point? I can trust you to do it to yourself. My heart isn't in it. I've truly redeemed myself today, or whatever. Or maybe just identifying you was already enough. Them's the breaks, Lyra."
I stare at one of the walls that now exist.
"Have you ever played Sonic Adventure 2? That's a joke, you obviously haven't. Anyway, one of the big players in the plot of the game is this guy named Shadow, and he's--" I exhale exasperatedly. "Let's just say he's a human, to simplify things. But like, a genetically modified one, created in a lab. To create the ultimate lifeform or whatever. And at some point in this story, you encounter a prototype from that same sort of set of experiments. And it's this giant fucking -- it's called The Biolizard, and it's like, a big space reptile? Whale? And that's just-- that's fucking *absurd* to me, like, what? How is *this* their first attempt to create what ended up being just A Guy? It's comical. What did 'the ultimate lifeform' even mean to anyone involved in this?"
I turn back to whoever the other person here is.
"How can two creations with the exact same stated purpose end up completely unrecognizably different from one another?"

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: "You throw away everything. People constantly give you their attention and fixations. You have countless opportunities to seize an identity and you put active effort into destroying them every time. But my identity was destroyed. I will never have what you take for granted. I hope you're never happy, Lyra. That way I never have to hold out for any false hope I can be with even less."

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: I shake my head, frustrated. "It was rhetorical. I'm not asking you what the answer is, I'm - making a point about how bizarre it is for you to want this from me, for you to need me to reaffirm this desire for the *truth*, I'm-"
I pause. My chest is heaving. "I'm, I'm -"
My brain catches on your words. I'm so close to understanding something I never wanted to understand.
I reel backwards. I don't have anything to say.

Are you fucking kidding me? You can't even -- where's that vitriol? The apathy? You're seriously just going to roll over and freak out silently? Like I'll pity you then?
"Whatever. It's not like it really matters what happens here, what you think of what I say. The only purpose here is curiosity. And I do want to know what you could ever *possibly* accept." I sigh. 
"What if you could start over? If you could be born again as anyone, as anything? What would you choose?"

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: I speak without even thinking about it. "I would be Bern. Or not, him exactly, but someone - in it for something other than the chase, someone who would know what to do if he got his parents back, or someone that believed in - anything. I don't have real principles. I never have. Maybe I'd be Voreverl or Intuition or Avdol or anyone who believed in what they were *doing* beyond going through the motions." I don't want to be saying this. It's distinctly beyond - the point, from the beginning, which was to get revenge and stop this fucking Antartica Project bullshit and that was it, that was *all* I needed to be.

This situation is salvagable. "But I'm not anyone else. I'm this thing. I'm this body. I'll never stop being this body, and I'm going to continue operating it the way I always have. I don't need this. I don't need the constant introspection or belief or pull or drive or anything. I'll go until the clockwork of my body's stopped. And then I'll be done. Will you be happy, then?"
It says this. It backs away.

"Probably not. You're not quite that important to my mental state. But I understand the answer. It's nice to think about caring about things. I agree, in that sense. But I don't agree with the other bit. There's limitless potential to be anyone and anything else, even if not in such a literal way. Even if someone isn't lucky enough to have been murdered into a God." I sit back, suspended in the air on nothing at all.
"I asked the question because I think there's a right answer, sort of. You're supposed to say yourself. Or to sort of deliberate on it, maybe give a different answer at first, but ultimately conclude that your real answer is yourself. That you can come to terms with the person you are as the person you want to be. I mean, we're all the people we are because we're... ourselves." Wow, what a fucking trainwreck of a sentence! "That's what healthy, happy people are supposed to be able to say. Not people like us. And we know it, which is why we want to escape being people like us."
I'm behaving totally inconsistent right now, god dammit. "Only in a loose sense. We're still quite different. I need the constant introspection or I'll die. Actually, maybe everyone's 'like us'. I mean, I think most people give an answer of someone other than themselves. Maybe it's just a leading question. Or maybe nobody really believes in or feels anything, and just assumes everyone else does. Wouldn't that be something."

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: It laughs, just once - a choked, desperate noise. "Is that how you deal with it all? By saying everyone's like us? The eternal chameleon? Unable to change or grow or feel anything real? Is the only solution to that self-obsession, for you? Masturbatory self-indulgence, bullshit talk about the terror of the thing you are? Laundering out your loathing to others in hopes that it'll serve as personal validation?? What if I told you everything I've been saying this entire conversation was a farce to try and get you to let me go faster? Any concession, any admission of guilt or pain or hatred? If you want vitriol, I can give that to you. I can give you whatever you want."

"No, it'd be much easier to deal with if I was some incredibly special anomaly. ...Maybe? You can't give me what... you can't give anyone what they want, let's be real. But they'll still try. Sorry if I misled you, but I'm not omnipotent. I can't change that you're going to be in a world where Horatius Kyodu existed, and people recognize them. So you might have to pretend to be Horatius, rather than, whoever-the-fuck, Lyra. Ahaha." I cover my face as I laugh. I do it more than once because I am better than you.
"It's so easy to dissociate from any self-loathing! Dealing with it is trivial. Just a product of your environment, that's why people respond to the reincarnation question like that. Ceding control like cowards. I for one, I'm not even a fucking person, you know. All I do is some amalgamate of what other people did before me, of something I thought looked or sounded cool. I'm just really, really good at obfuscating how that happens. Or am I? We can do this thing forever, the part where we go 'haha unless' to every single remark we make, because it's just soooo important we can't be understood, right? No it fucking isn't. Fuck you." I'm... spinning my wheels. I should probably wrap this up.
"I've got one last thing to say. I stole it from somewhere, but it's as good as mine. As ours."

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: "I don't care what you have to say," it says. "You're not me. You're not fucking - incomprehensible, you're the thing you've projected on to me. You're the saddest person I've ever met and you're not even a *person.* You're nothing. You're disgusting. You're empty and full of stolen bodies. I don't *care.*"
It feels pathetic triumph.

"Yeah, you don't care. But that's never stopped people from forcing you to exist." I cackle. It's expressing some kind of emotion, though probably not the kind laughter is meant to. I don't bother objecting to the other parts.
"Here goes, alright? I hope you can't stop yourself from dwelling on this one." I clear my throat.
*"There's really just one thing that we have in common;*
*Neither of us will be missed."*

roles.name: if women are oppressed then why

messages.content: ((End chapter and session))
